document_title: Cervical cancer: Causes, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content: Cervical Cancer is a malignant disease of squamous epithelial cells or cervical glandular epithelial cells that develop abnormally, leading to the formation of tumors. in the cervix. These tumors multiply uncontrollably, invade and affect surrounding organs, most commonly metastasizing to the lungs, liver, bladder, vagina and rectum. (2)
subsection_title: ung thu co tu cung.json. Cervical cancer is what?
subsection_data:
ung thu co tu cung.json. Cervical cancer is what?
Cervical Cancer is a malignant disease of squamous epithelial cells or cervical glandular epithelial cells that develop abnormally, leading to the formation of tumors. in the cervix. These tumors multiply uncontrollably, invade and affect surrounding organs, most commonly metastasizing to the lungs, liver, bladder, vagina and rectum. (2)
